definitions.definition: to or at a distance from somebody/something in space or time

examples.text: The beach is a mile away.
Christmas is still months away.
The president was kept **well away** from the demonstrators.
The station is a few minutes' walk away from here.
The main landfill site was moved **further away** from the city.

definitions.definition: to a different place or in a different direction

examples.text: Go away!
Put your toys away.
The bright light made her look away.
There were ten children away yesterday.
Sorry, he's away.
She was away from work for a week.

definitions.definition: used after verbs to say that something is done continuously or with a lot of energy

examples.text: She was still writing away furiously when the bell went.
They were soon chatting away like old friends.
The water boiled away.
The music faded away.

definitions.definition: at the opponent’s ground or stadium

examples.text: Chelsea are playing away this Saturday.

definitions.definition: used to say that you would like to be rid of somebody/something

examples.text: Away with all these rules and regulations!

definitions.definition: to help somebody have a fresh, lively state of mind again

examples.text: A brisk walk should blow the cobwebs away.

definitions.definition: to dance for the whole evening or night

examples.text: She's far and away the best player.
I want it sent right away.
I told him right off what I thought of him.
I'll do it straight away.

wordOrigin: Old English onweg, aweg ‘on one's way’ (from a- ‘to, towards’ and way).
